metadata.title: CVE-2022-46871 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium
metadata.description:
An out of date library (libusrsctp) contained vulnerabilities that couldpotentially be exploited. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 108.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-46871` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libusrsctp-examples - 0.9.5.0-2
libusrsctp2 - 0.9.5.0-2
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libusrsctp package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.9.5.0-2').
thunderbird package in mantic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu1').
